comments: Great place with plenty of space to have fun.

name: Sullivan Campground
comments: Nice park for overnighter. Picnic tables. Toilet. Some shade. Creek. Watch for crocs. Fishing.

name: Miling Camping ground
comments: Great little spot!

name: Big Horse Creek Campground
comments: Really enjoyed camping under the Boabs.

name: Hide Away Campground
location: 401 Shore Rd, Dingwall, NS B0C 1G0, Canada
comments: Cabins, tent lots, RV lots, whatever your preference. Beautiful view of the Aspey mountains! With a gorgeous beach just around the corner (piping plovers live there). Ideal location if you want to explore the highland national park. Their showers are pretty great, and warm up super quick! The owners are very kind and have all sorts of information of things to do in the area :)

This was our first stop on our NS vacation and we could have stayed here the whole time! Clean friendly camping with all the necessary amenities. The grounds is right on  the Aspy river, and the views are breath taking! Witnessed an engagement during sunrise, and I'm sure it was perfect for them. A 12 km sandy beach is a 5 minute drive, and being at the tip of the trail you can go west or east to find hiking and great food stops, or stay in the grounds for fresh oysters and lobster caught daily. 5 stars all day.

Absolutely a must for a get away vacation with your family. We just wrapped up a stay at the farmhouse at Hideaway and had a flawless week our entire family will never forget. The property is clean and comfortable. The location could not be better for proximity to one of the best beaches in the province as far as we are concerned. The water is clean and the warmest we have ever encountered in Nova Scotia. The sand is powder soft and we pretty much had the beach to ourselves the entire week. This is no small beach I might add. We will definitely be booking again next year. Thank you Susan and Alex. Great job!!!

Well run, beautiful campground with a spectacular view.

We stayed here for 1 night as we went around the Cabot Trail. 

We reserved an unserviced site, which was a reasonable size and fairly nicely wooded (we were able to string up a tarp over our tent). Washrooms, water stations, and dish-washing stations were within a minute's walk. The campground was nice and quiet in the evening / overnight, and the view was amazing.

Looking around, it seemed that most of the reservable sites were similarly nice. The prices were some of the best we encountered on our entire maritime road trip, too.

There also appeared to be ample overflow space. If you end up in overflow space, don't worry: while you won't have trees, you'll probably have the best view in the place, looking over the cliff down at the water and across to the mountains.

Washrooms were clean, however be warned that showers do cost $1 / 5 minutes, which is a minor irritant.

The management / owners were excellent! A special thanks to Susan, in the office, who not only directed us to, but called and set up a meeting with, a local mechanic to look at a concern with our vehicle. This was well above and beyond our expectations.

Definitely a great spot to camp along the Cabot trail.

Stunning location & friendly staff. Site was clean & fairly secluded. My wife & I enjoyed a lobster dinner & freshly shucked oysters during our stay (food was purchased & prepared at the camp but we ate it at our site). Would visit again!

name: Meat Cove Campground & Oceanside Chowder Hut
location: 2479 Meat Cove Rd, Capstick, NS B0C 1E0, Canada
comments: Great camp site, especially for those who like to feel like they're camping off the grid. This place is like no other campground I've been to. If you are travelling the Cabot trail this is a must see spot, even if you don't plan to camp over night. There is a chowder hut that has been newly renovated and has a very good menu - I recommend the chowder bowl. This place has free WiFi, showers, toilets, drinking water and they sell ice and fire wood. Otherwise you will want to bring all of the groceries you need as there are no stores near by. There are several hiking trails that have amazing views. The staff are so friendly and helpful. We stayed in site number 25 (pictured is the view of the beach and ocean from site 25). Have fun!

As far as campsites go, it's reasonably priced and not likely to be overbooked so as to need a reservation before hand. Amenities are great with flush toilets, phone charging outlets and wifi. But the real joy is an unobstructed view of a shale cove, scenic mountains, and watching waves roll into the rock beach for hours on end. This was definitely the highlight of our Cape Breton trip.

The view alone is worth the drive there. We had some time to kill before our whale watching tour with Oshan Whale Watch at nearby Bay St. Lawrence, 20 or so minute drive. It was worth seeing it from land and from the boat later. A great place to camp out for sure.
Incredible view! The staff were super friendly and the beach is great for just spending a couple hours on. It can be insanely windy though so beware tenting!

Amazing view and amazing location. Drove to Meat Cove along an unpaved road. There is a campsite here and also cabin rentals. They also have a restaurant. I had the clam chowder, I was a little early so the veggies were a little crunchy. Offered to steam our crab we bought on the wharf on the way to Meat Cove.

name: Phipps Park
location: 2175 SW Locks Rd, Stuart, FL 34997, USA
comments: We have returned to this friendly, laid-back place for six consecutive years. You will have great views of beautiful boats making their way through the locks. The sites are very large, and there is plenty of room to exercise even the not-so-small dog. Most of all, park manager Joe does such an outstanding job of keeping this gem clean, quiet, and safe.

Love this camp ground!!

Wesley Lowell Renzas
Beautiful spot, friendly ranger, super clean bathrooms, an awesome place to stay. This is our second trip and we will be back!

The campground is nestled in a beautiful setting. The whole park was extremely clean and well maintained. The staff was super friendly. Me and my 12 year old loved setting up camp here for the night. Thanks!  More than reasonable camp cost.

I've never felt more unwelcome at a campground.  The guy or ranger who lives there is a complete jerk who takes his job way too seriously, I'll just leave it at that.  I was going to stay but wasn't certain so I left and when I came back, he was on break or whatever so as he instructed me, I took the spot he told me was open and when I did, before I could even get setup, I got a knock on my camper.  I opened my door.  My dog of course being a dog jumps out of the camper and the guy immediately starts laying into me telling me I need to have my dog on a leash at all times!  I'm supposed to put my dog on a leash inside the camper before I open the door?!  Give me a break!  Then, I had a friend coming to visit and when I gave her the code, the one he gave me was wrong (on purpose maybe?, I wouldn't doubt it).  So, I go to try and get him out of his residence (he lives there) and he finally gives me the right code after she had been waiting out there and when she finally was able to come in, there was a truck behind her that also tried to come in and instead of telling the guy in the truck he couldn't come in, he goes off on me like it was my fault!  This is after he gave me the wrong code!  I've never been treated so rudely at a campsite and will never go back because of this jerk.  He lives there and I think he believes he owns the park, not sure.  Usually park Rangers are there to make you feel welcome and appreciative for the business.  Not this guy, he's there to give you an attitude, I would've left but I had no where else to go.  I will NEVER go back as long as that jerk is running the place.  I don't think he's going anywhere living there so I strongly recommend finding another park to camp unless you want to feel like someone is watching your every move.  Definitely not what I was expecting, so glad I'm outta there.

name: Butch's Fishcamp & RV Park
comments: Hometown Bar On The Water In Okeechobee Florida. Reasonable Prices. Good Service.

I live here and it's peaceful. New owners are doing great things with the park. I see a negative review about the park and they are only upset because they were ran out for selling drugs. Good, decent owners and management who care for the park.
Cost of beverage little high. To hot very uncomfortable .

I live here quite  peaceful..
A real reaxliny  placeto be.
Great place under going new management pretty nice new food wagon and bar coming soon

name: Treasure Coast RV Resort
location: 2550 Crossroads Pkwy, Fort Pierce, FL 34945, USA
comments: Treasure Coast Rv park stands only with their compilation! They are the best RV park that we have ever been to.  The pool, bathrooms, laundry rooms and the ground are immaculate. The landscaping is impeccable. Diane in the office is the best one to work with. The other girls are good but Diane is the one who can get stuff done. The campers are friendly and there are many wonderful activities.
This is such a beautiful place. It's very clean and so far everyone seems friendly.

Nice Property!!  I was planning on staying here and visit with my father, However, He reminded me that the camp had some strict rules which I respected, or so I thought (I can appreciate other peoples property) But when I have a guy approach me on a golf cart give me a EXTREMELY hard time because I am driving through the park because Im a visitor and I shouldn't be driving through the property as visitor... And THREATEN ME... telling me he would CALL THE COPS because Im driving through the park?  Barney Fife  seems to really be excessive. So If you want to stay a a camp full of "rules"  You will love this place. Mandatory Fun is at 5pm.. Oh, and stay off the lawn..
Clean paved sites. Super friendly residents.  Lots of activities

Great place!! Friendly staff and very well maintained. All paved streets with excellent concrete pads and hookups. Pet walk area was a bit inconvenient other wise I would have given 5 stars. We will definitely return.

name: Water's Edge RV Resort
comments: The summer rate was reasonable. It is a smaller park, but very well taken care of. All of the lots are on level brick pavers. You couldn't hear the highway at all from inside the camper. The next time we are in town if a spot is available, I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again.

4-13-16 - What a gem!!! Generous sites - pool - boat ramp - wonderful sunsets from the palapa by the canal - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Air Boat ride just up the street a few miles - pulled pork, barbeque at a little trailer. Great experience would recommend highly.
Very pretty, clean, staff is great, nice pool, clubhouse is very nice. On the Okeechobee canal☺

Beautiful, quiet facility on the northeast shore of the rim canal surrounding Lake Okeechobee. Sites are all full hookups with paver stones, are spacious and landscaped. There is good shade except mid day. They have a large, nice pool and clubhouse, clean restrooms and wifi. Picnic tables and a chair swing are in a large expanse of shaded lawn with a bonfire area, next to a petanque court and a horseshoe pit. It's a great place to enjoy nature.
There it's a nice boat launch, fishing area with a cleaning table  A chickee but is by the water with comfortable chairs, end tables and a swing for reading, napping our enjoying the sunset with a cool beverage.
The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. They participate in Passport Amwrica and Good Sam discount clubs.
The only drawback is that "town" is about 10 miles away.

name: Fort Pierce / Port St. Lucie KOA
location: 1821 Old US Hwy 1, Fort Pierce, FL 34946, USA
comments: We brought a new RV from Winnibeago back to our Miami office and stopped overnight to recharge. Gina at the front desk couldn't be nicer. Great location for the price.
Just a gravel yard, but nice people. No pool, no beach shuttle

Great staff the manager Nadine is wonderful if any problems willing to accommodate and rectify the situation immediately.  The owner Barry is wonderful and very pleasant cares about the park.  Wonderful place to stay love the sound of the train!!  Shopping, restaurants and liquor store within walking distance.
Do not stay here.  There is no pool and no security.  The back gate was left open all day and night.  Cars were cutting through from the road that ran behind the campground.  Also, no amenities.
Very quiet restrooms were nice and clean.. Love that the marina and beach was there. They even had enough room for our truck... Thank you and will diffently be back.

name: Road Runner Travel Resort
location: 5500 St Lucie Blvd, Fort Pierce, FL 34946, USA
comments:
Love this place! It's quiet, friendly, the spots are large enough for anything and it's very close to anywhere you'd like to go. The beach is only minutes away but the surrounding area is a nice rural look. 

There is a pool, tennis court, shuffle board, basketball court and a community fire pit. (Fires are not permitted anywhere but designated camp spots. Check with front desk or website for details.) There is also a shower house with 3 private showers, 3 toilets and 4 sinks. It's nice and tiled and clean. A laundry is available with varying sizes of washers and dryers. Bring your own laundry detergent or buy at the camp store, there are no machines to buy any. The machines take quarters, which are available at the camp store. There is also an ATM there, as well as some camping essentials and odds and ends a person may need.  

The spots include rental units,rustic cabins, pull this, spots for tv's and tents.
Very impressed. Immaculately Clean place and staff is super friendly/helpful. We definitely will have to stay here again. The Coyote Grill is a definite must try. The food is super yummy!

This is a very clean and we'll managed park. Location is quiet yet close to the beaches, Ft. Pierce inlet and other amenities. Camp store is nice and well stocked with groceries and RV supplies. I was very impressed with this place!

Parked my extra vehicle in their secure area which had a sign " not responsible for belongings"!  Had to fill out paperwork and got chewed out by the desk lady. I understand the need for rules but someone on their board is making rules that assume everyone needs to be treated like a child. We won't be staying there again.
Very family friendly place. The villas are very clean and up to date. All of the staff are very nice and helpful. Very nice get away.

name: Port St Lucie RV Resort
location: 3703 SE Jennings Rd, Port St Lucie, FL 34952, USA
comments: Lots of shopping centers and highways surround this very well kept campground. 20, 30 & 50 amp service posts are keenly placed on every level concrete slab. All connections from RV to facility utilities were easy runs to clean and secure hook-ups. Local area activities in all directions outside of resort. Laundry facilities and pool on location including a picnic table at each site. Ask for shaded trees if possible. Outside signage is dwarfed by signage for storage facility. Look for gates and lots of RVs to narrow search to entrance. Full circle or 8 mph race track loop with one way road best describes this resorts traffic way with back in spots at about every 25 to 30 feet of each other allowing  space between neighbors. Very quiet camping guests while we stayed here in late April. Did not use cable or WiFi. We did not use pool or other facilities but they appeared well maintained. We stayed 3 nights. Nice place.
Excellent. A quiet and completely clean place. The management is very friendly and you can feel family atmosphere.
Been staying there off and on for 3 years, pool is great,plenty of spaces, people are friendly and price is fair.

The park was decent, but the new management seems to operate with the belief that the guests are "the enemy". A lot of dumb signs telling you what you can't do. They make you feel unwelcome and as if helping you is a burden.
The wifi is better closer to the clubhouse but all in all this wonderful place!

name: Okeechobee KOA Resort
location: 4276 US Highway 441 South, Okeechobee, FL 34974, USA
comments: We absolutely loved our little cabin at this campground. My kids had so much fun roasting marshmallows and just relaxing for the weekend. We honestly didn't leave our site much because we were just so relaxed and happy to there. I'd definitely recommend KOA for camping and if you want to do a little less ruffing it.. the cabins are the way to go.. beds off the ground and an ac.. that's all we needed and we were happy.
It's very clean, the staff is super friendly. The other guests are great. We've made some great friends. And at night the shanty is a blast.

Everything and everyone has been great. Our toddler twins have enjoyed everyone saying hello to them on our walks around the KOA.  Friendly staff and visitors. Great amenities for family fun and plenty of adult only amenities. Conveniently located and clean restrooms/laundry facilities throughout. I would definitely stay again!
I have stayed in both the dry cabins and the deluxe cabins and loved every minute of it. This location is super pet friendly as well. Can't wait to return for another visit!

This park has “A” & “C” rated sites.  All sites are clean, well maintained and the bath houses are clean.  I would stay here again, however I would consider where I would park my rig next time.  The problem is not KOA’s making but effects weekday campers.  The sites along the southwest side of the park (the first two streets when you drive in have deluxe sites) is located next to a RV repair yard doing major repairs all weekdays.  The sound of air drills, staplers, grinders and what not drown out any peace and quiet you would expect.

name: Big Lake Lodge & Rv's
comments: I stayed here with my family. The first day I arrived it was nice.  I returned after Christmas vacation to find all my stuff gone through and I was told I was moving from my original rental we agreed apon . So I reluctantly did. Moving into a camper they provider for 200.00 a week. I rarely had lights because the battery would die. The water had so much bleach that it bleached our clothes. This includes the water you shower in. It burnt our eyes. My daughter cried for almost an hour one night. I believe all this was done to cover up the feces smell that covered the camp ground some days. I just hope their properly disposing of the raw sewage. Several of the older people Thanked  me for addressing this issue. My wife done a sex offender search and they had one residing in the park and he still does. They seem to have no problem with that even though one of his charges was children pornagraphy.  I find that very disturbing. Then the last day/night we were there we told them we were leaving. They came and and inspected the camper. They were pleased. Until 830 at night, when they came knocking on my camper demanding 300.00 more dollars. Saying they were prorating a month. Which we never rented month to month. We rented week to week for 200.00 and i always paid them. They are crooks!! They done some friends of mine the exact same way. Threw them out over night with a child and his wife being pregnant. Left them with no place to go because they told them they were moving in a few days as well. This is not how you do buisness!! They also own a few others. Please be aware.
Ok location, great manager
Great find. The owner and her staff are amazing. Best spot for a Florida Sunset.
very safe ..family oriented ...the owners are wonderful ...

Visited this RV resort last week expecting to find a large crowded RV camp. I found a small very quiet, nice and friendly resort with hosts who were friendly and helpful.  Stores, gas station, market,  mechanic shop, etc.  all within a two block distance.  Great sunsets, good fishing from the docks, I would go back and will be back soon.  Mike

name: Pitchford's RV
location: 3830 NE Indian River Dr, Jensen Beach, FL 34957, USA
comments: A little piece of heaven! Very casual and lots of room. Staff always goes out of their way if a concern arises. Walking distance to downtown Jensen and many restaurants and shops as well. Water views and down to earth people. No stress and always welcoming!
Great spot with great views. Quiet and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops.
A wonderful location. An Eclectic crowd and very nice people for the most part. The staff are spectacular.
Great location. Fabulous views.
No amenities but nice and quiet. Outstanding location.

name: Vantage Oaks RV Park
comments: It's a great place to stay. Quiet clean park off the beaten path. Very relaxing. 👍

If you've seen one trailer park you have seen them all. It seems quite and people that live there seem to care about where they live at which plays a big part. I'm giving it a four star cause it's still a trailer park
Unfortunately The Mobile Homes Are Entirely Too Close To Each Other, The Grounds Weren't Kept Up Very Well At All & Not One Individual, Man Nor Woman Ever Waved or Gave A Polite Passing Smile...
Quiet RV park affordable rate (lowest in the Okeechobee area
Its nice if you want peice and quiet

name: Zachary Taylor RV Resort
comments: Pretty crowded, but well maintained, nice people and pool. Just put in all new docks. Campground located right by the lock to enter lake Okeechobee. Great bass fishing and speck fishing.
Lots of Great Bass and Catfish. And Bird watching.
It down to earth and friendly its also a 55 and older park we r just visiting
Nice place. Expensive
Amazing park. Very clean and well maintained.  Totally hassle free, will return.

name: Savannas Recreation Area
location: 1400 E Midway Rd, Fort Pierce, FL 34982, USA
comments: Wonderful place and it was a very enjoyable experience. We went during the week so it wasn't very crowded and at night it was peaceful and quiet. We definitely would recommend it.

Recently completed Indian Hills Recreation Area is located off Savannah Road between Indian River Drive and US1.  The area boasts picnic areas, walking trails and a trail around the perimeter of the newly expanded retention pond with workout stations.  Parking is located on both sides of Savannah Road: on the south side and on the north side behind the animal control building.  Both parking areas are accessible via a walking path that crosses Savannah Road. Beautifully landscaped and hidden away, it is uncrowded and lightly used so far, but as the news of the renovations become more widely known, I expect this park to become a favorite of locals.
There is a nice paved jogging path towards the back of the campground and fun playground for kids. The area is quiet and scenic. There is also a dog park in the area.

The campground was located all the way south of US1. It is gated at night with a pin pad for entry... and open to public during the day..The park was large and very well-maintained. The RV section of the park did not have a lot of privacy but had numerous fifth wheels and campers.The lot size was decent. The speed limit is 10 mph and everyone will make sure that that is obeyed.. so be cautious when driving through. The center of the RV park has a large circle seating area for bonfire fire pit some type of group activity. There was an office at the front that is a trailer home and a Nother trailer home in the center that two local sheriffs deputy's reside in. There are a few employees all that seemed friendly. In the center of the park there is a concrete building with the men and women's facility, two toilets & two showers that were well-kept. Laundry facility that has coin-operated machines. There are camping sites available for people with tense. They have three separate choices for campsites. All of the prices were affordable and offer optional amenities. There was small playground with slide and swings that is surrounded by a chain-link fence. There is a dog walk area that is fenced in chain-link is well. There are small canals that run throughout the park. The lands are natural savanna preserve not to be disturbed. There was a mixture of people from the RV park to the campsites. There were retired couples with small pets to families with young children to early 20s. Everybody says it was very friendly and sociable with each other. I recommend this for a safe clean facility that is large and has a variety of ages.

It is a beautiful place and the people very friendly.  The place is a wildlife sanctuary so it is important to realize that and respect the wildlife as we are guests on their preserve.  It is a bird watchers paradise and there are alligators!  Pets must be leashed at all times and please respect others and the native species by picking up after them.  Also don't feed the animals.  It is tempting but this is a wilderness preserve and we should attempt to observe but don't disturb!  This campground has hook-ups for RV's and campsites. It has laundry facilities a historic small house that serves as the office, merger camp store and lounge.  The wi-if doesn't work well but maybe it shouldn't - come to relax and unwind!  The bathrooms are ok not fancy but relatively clean and would be cleaner if each guest cleaned up after themselves - hint. It is a special place and if you can take time to "smell the coffee" and relax you will love being here. Tell them Robert sent you! Hope to be back at some point!

name: Tanglewood Village
comments: This is a great place to stay, if you are 55 or older, it is quite and the people are very friendly.
Its not to big nice people a lake swimming pool close to stores .
Peaceful GREAT PEOPLE AND MY BEST FREIND LIVES THERE JOE

name: St. Lucie South
comments: Nice site (RV8) but tons of ants. Gonna start the battle later after visit to Walmart. Will re-review after two week stay.
What a well kept secret. This campground is right at the dam. It's very peaceful and quiet. The staff are very helpful and nice.
This education center was not on the map. There is a host of information at the visitor center. You can walk over he lock and hike a small naure trail that is abundant in butterflies.
Loved this little campground!
quiet and peaceful small family park.

name: Living Hope Camp Foundation
location: Living Hope Camp, Taroy, wangal, La Trinidad, 2601 Benguet, Philippines
comments: has most of the needed amenities, but it does not have a covered court
Best camp site ever!!

name: D. N. Flores Mango Farm and City Mountain Resort
location: Sitio Calaungan, Nagyubuyuban, San Fernando, La Union, Philippines

name: The Manor at Camp John Hay
location: Camp John Hay, Ordonio Dr, Camp John Hay, Baguio, 2600 Benguet, Philippines
comments: I gave it 4 stars for the greenery and space, hotel is quite old and pricey and their water smells funky (maybe because of a rusty water tank). Our house has better toilets. Hahaha! I've stayed at much better hotels. Staff are not that pleasant unlike the other Baguio hotels I've stayed in. I hope  they do something about it and upgrade some of their fixtures. I've been here plenty of times and they never changed. I'd prefer Le Monet, much newer. But then again, The Manor is The Manor.

The best place to stay in Baguio. Offers peace and quiet, and the dining is just 5 star! All rooms are clean and functional, and you do really get what you pay for. I also recommend that you would avail of membership if you plan on visiting Baguio at least twice or thrice a year. It is also a great place for business meetings, and for family trips. If you might as well have the budget, book immediately! Specially if you plan to stay in Baguio during the months of December or February-March.
Warm and welcoming. They always greet you and make you feel like manor is your home. Great food.
One of the best hotels I have stayed. The rooms are big and spacious. You will experience its ambience of Baguio. Also they have a lot of amenities.
Would love to come back.. Very nice place. The food is oh so yummy

name: Saint Alfonso's Place
location: # 36 Purok 7,, Bakakeng Norte Road, Baguio, 2600 Benguet, Philippines
comments:
Now I have more reason to go to Baguio because of this place! I love the cozy ambiance, very good and attentive staff! The rooms are clean and well maintained. Home away from home.

Plus a very big bonus, the super yummy food prepared by the owner itself. Soo good I don't want to go back to Manila anymore. 
Definitely value for money!

A place just like home. Good service pleasant and attentive staff, excellent food they serve best gourmet and hearty dishes made especially by the owner. Pet friendly place too... 
My favorite place to stay in baguio :)

Saint Alfonso's Place is a beautiful place to relax and stay in. If you are the adventurous type, it would be a great place to stay, to feel Baguio's weather in all its glory. At the same time, Saint Alfonso's Place has a sense of home and coziness that I could not feel elsewhere. I would strongly recommend this place to friends and family who want to relax and feel comfortable in Baguio.
Just worth the price.
Very homelike experience.

name: Fukuroda Bungalow Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒319-3524 Ibaraki-ken, Kuji-gun, Daigo-machi, Shimotsuhara, 茨城県久慈郡大子町下津原
comments:
商売人として、最低最悪の対応。
逆ドタキャンした上に、何の対応もしてくれないお粗末さです。
理由はどうあれ、宿泊3日前に予約を一方的に取り消したのだから、普通はお客様が困らないように代わりを用意するのでは？。
サービス悪い

name: Kinugawaonsen Auto Camping Ground
comments: 川有り、近くに観光場所多く2泊はできます。キャンプ場じたいは普通。風呂があるのがいいですね！
お風呂もついていてトータル的に良いです。地面は固め。ペグも一苦労
管理人さんの人柄が良く場内の清掃も行き届いています。もちろん温泉付きは最高ですね。
場所は良かったが、雨だったので移動が大変だった。
川沿いにあって、色々自由に出来て良かったです。

name: Ishiokashi Tsukubane Auto Camping Ground
comments: nice place for camping with AC outlet and coin shower.
Bulan lalu saya pergi kesana meski cuaca waktu itu hujan tapi karena lokasinya cukup nyaman jadi acara BBQ tetap berjalan lancar
キャンプサイト、炊事場、トイレはキレイ。草が生えた坂になった広場があり、子供達は夢中でした。ブユに注意。
フリーサイトを利用。某国の団体と鉢合わせ。散々でした。
職員の対応はお役所と同じですが環境としては素晴らしい❗近場の避暑地として是非お薦めします。

name: Nikkodaiyagawa Park Auto Camping Ground
comments:
The location in the map is good! 
Takes about 25min walking from the closest JR station.
Price expansive for free site tent about 2570¥ / tent and 1540¥ december till january.
There is accomodation free shower 7:00 am to 10pm (hot water, electricity, clean toilet and wifi...)
Also they sell wood, charcoal water soap and others stuff...
Good
Beautiful!
トイレ、炊事場が綺麗に保たれていた。川沿いのキャンプ場ではない。近くにアスレチックがあって大人子供も楽しめる。地場野菜の販売所や大型スーパーも近くにありました。標高は低め、気温は街中と変わらない
公営キャンプ場です、全体的に整備された場内は初心者からベテランまで楽しめるつくりです。チェックアウトが10時なので朝の撤収はゆっくりしたい方には辛いかも。チェックアウト時間が遅くなれば★五つです

name: Sakuragawashi Tsukubakogen Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒300-4412 Ibaraki-ken, Sakuragawa-shi, Makabechō Hatori, 土俵場国有林
comments: 空いててラッキー。水洗トイレと水道があって高床式のテントサイト。二組程度で一ヶ所の敷地を使える。筑波山頂上まで1.5kmのハイキング。静かで何もないのがいい感じ。

景色がよく
管理人さんの感じも良いです

駐車場からテントサイトは山登りと同等の道であり、荷物をもっての移動は苦役でした

お盆前の休日はテントサイト満員だったため、なんとか隅っこに場所を確保できました

2016年7月に友人と2人で持ち込みテント一泊で利用しました。バンガロー、テントサイトは駐車場より高低差があり、1番上のテントサイトは絶景でした。当日は雨がぱらついていたので星空を拝む事はできませんでしたが、その雨音も含め鳥のさえずり、虫の鳴き声、すべて楽しめるキャンプ場です。トイレ、シャワー室も綺麗に清掃されておりました。キャンプ場までの道が途中から砂利敷きなので到着まで少し不安になる道のりです。
荷物運びの苦労も含めて星5です。

夜景が凄くキレイです。
筑波山の裏なので、結構穴場です。でもシーズンになると予約で一杯になりますので、早めの予約が必要です。
裏から登山すると、川に沿って登れますし、人が少ないので表から登るよりは楽しいかと思います。

■プラス点
・最上段の眺望は最高です。
・管理人さんが親切です。
・安くて空いています。

■マイナス点
・最上段まで荷物を担いで登ると死にます。

name: Tanoue Camping Ground
comments: 意外と穴場かも。８月下旬の土日での利用でしたが、天気もいいのに4組しかおらず、実に快適。海も近いのて、海水浴シーズンはそれなりに混むようですが、オーシャンビューなのはいいですね。ネックは幹線道路から近いため、族の爆音が時々やってきてうるさいことぐらいでしょうか。夜は近くにのぞみの湯？だったかな、温泉もあり、さっぱり出来ました。
防波堤が色々釣れる　ちなサーブ系仕掛けが良い
ロケーション最高
風が強い

name: Oarai Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒311-1301 Ibaraki-ken, Higashiibaraki-gun, Ōarai-machi, Isohamachō, 大洗町磯浜町８２３１
comments: テント泊はフリーサイトなので好きなところに張れる。地面は砂地で注意しないと靴やテント内に砂が入り込んでくる。猫が結構いてテントを張る場所に糞などをしていないか要チェック。トイレはウォッシュレットで奇麗に管理されている。受付は17時までで大人自転車で1300円。8月ということもあってか湿度と気温がマックスでテント内で汗だくだった。蚊は普通にいるので虫除けスプレーが必要。ちょっと残念なのは近くの道でトラックが夜中ずっと走りまくっていて、結構音がうるさかったこと。また来たいか？うーん微妙だ。

バイクキャンプにて宿泊(1300円+500円)、フリーサイト内にバイクを持ち込めるので、テントのそばに愛車がおけます。
ただ、地面が砂質の為、受付でスタンドの下に引く板を借りていくのが無難です。
テントの予約貸出などもあり、スーパーも目の前にありますので、手ぶらキャンプもできます。
入浴施設は遠いので、チェックイン後にゆっくら館(16:00から500円でタオルなし、レンタルあり)に行くのがいいです。
バイクキャンプを始めたい方はキャンプ用品を買わずに実験的に泊まるのにもオススメです。
潮干狩りのあと、15時すぎに入りましたが、余裕で入れました。海にも近く、スーパーがすぐとなりで便利です。キャンプ場内は、区画もなく自由に好きなところに設営でき、混んでなければ広々スペースで楽しめると思います。

キャビンに泊まりました。キャビンの中はとにかく綺麗。２段ベッドで上に２人下に３人眠れます。マットもあるのですが柔らかくて逆に腰が痛くて何回か起きました。行ったときはすいていたのかテントに泊まっているのは何組か。とにかくトイレもきれい。キャンプの裏手にはスーパー。併設している百均、ローソン。なんでもそろいます。海までは車の方がいいですね。坂がきつい。少し遠い。車でだったらサンビーチまで数分だから全然困らず。那珂湊の市場までも遠くないので、海鮮BBQとマグロのお刺身は美味しかった！キャビンには屋根付きでテーブル椅子があるので、卓上BBQが雨でもできる。周りには飾り付けがきれいにしてあるグループもあり、どこからか全くほえない犬も出てきて、子供たちが可愛がってました。大洗に泊まるときにはまた利用したいです。

何度も訪れています
周りは住宅地ですが周囲の木々が大きく以外とキャンプ感
自然感はあります
あと以外と広くイベント時にも予約なしでも何とかなる安心感
サイト奥にテントを張るとトイレが遠いのが難点かな

name: Choei Yamamoto Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒963-5685 Fukushima-ken, Higashishirakawa-gun, Tanagura-machi, 福島県東白川郡棚倉町大字北山本字小檜沢
comments:
トイレ、炊事場が綺麗。突然の雨にも屋根つきの休憩所あり。ただ車は最後まで入れませんのでリアカーを貸してくれます。(30分以内)バイクは少し先まで入れます。
料金も格安一人100円です。

クルマでたどり着けないのは痛い。
川の水量は少なめだが水質は超クリア。
綺麗な小川が流れていて素敵な場所です。
評判良い。

name: Nasutakahara Auto Camping Ground
comments:
まず料金が不透明。
区画のない電源サイトは魅力。だが、高い。
区画がはっきりしている所はせまい。でも高い。
受け付けのあばちゃんは気さくでいい人。
平日で貸し切り状態だと、お風呂も大きいし得した気分。
他の方のレビューを見ると、見回りがない為、外れた日は最悪そうです。高規格並の料金なので、その辺は徹底しないとなぁ。
施設は整ってます。
9月初旬の土日に行きましたがガラガラでした。フリーエリアは綺麗な芝生ですが木陰がないので暑そうでした。林間エリアは木陰でとても涼しく快適でした。炊事場やトイレはまだ新しいのか綺麗で、全体的にきちんと手入れされたキャンプ場という印象でした。

管理人さんは親切、好印象。客のマナー悪すぎ。安くないんだから深夜の見回りくらいしてほしいです。深夜２時過ぎまで奇声をあげ
、花火を振り回しの大騒ぎ。そーいうバカを規制運用してくれるようになったらまた行きたい。
設備は良いが適切に運用していない。消灯時間等ルールもほぼ未設定な為見廻りもなく遅くまで騒ぐ客と早朝から吠えるワンコで寝不足。スタッフもお母さんは親切だが小わっぱは大きな勘違いをしているような対応。しかも料金も非常に高くコスパが悪い。

ワンコにも寛容でとてもノンビリできました
露天風呂もとても良かったです
他の人も書いてますが、一部マナーが悪い客が深夜まで騒いでることがあるようです
若者のグループが深夜までコテージのテラスで大騒ぎしてたので、すぐそばのテントサイトの方はうるさかったと思います

name: 大子広域公園オートキャンプ場グリンヴィラ
comments: Exciting area for camping with cheap hot spring, peace place!

高規格という割に、リーズナブル。
近隣には色々なショップがある為、万が一でも大丈夫。
平日利用を望む人にはシーズンオフの毎週水曜日休みが痛い。
過保護過ぎるほど、手入れがされていて、ここより綺麗なキャンプ場はないだろうってなくらい。
区画の稼働率等を考えるとわからなくはないが、どんな時でもキャンセル料の話が必ずあるので、気軽には使えない感覚がある。
なので、いつも平日当日電話。
後、イベント実施時は必ず避ける。
静かに過ごしたい人には向かない。平日ならかろうじて。

何度も予約チャレンジしてますが、取れる気がしません(T-T)
連休はもちろん、週末の予約は電話つながらず。
予約は取れないキャンプ場だと思った方が良いと聞きました。行ってみたいなー。
とても綺麗なキャンプ場です。また風呂は温泉で露天風呂もあります。支配人を始めスタッフさんも良い方ばかりです。

スタッフさんの対応も良く、設備もしっかりしていて満足です。
  先日は別の所を使い対応悪くされ、連れと不機嫌だったのですが、ここは良かったです。

name: Kotakizawa Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒318-0103 Ibaraki-ken, Takahagi-shi, Nakadogawa, 茨城県高萩市大能
comments:
Pros: A free campsite next to a gorgeous river. Kids can play in the shallow water. Has toilets and a roofed table for bad weather. 

Cons: Not many spaces, no vending machines or stores nearby. Can fill quickly during summer vacation. 

My family's usual camping/day camping area.

自分のホームグランドです。
現在、トイレを工事中。
滝まで通行止めが解除になりました。
ただ、心無いキャンパーが食べ残し、使用した道具を放置、直火禁止なのに直火。流し台の中には洗い物のカスが詰まり流れませんでした。掃除はしてきましたが・・・
そんな、ルール、マナーが守れない方には来て欲しくない。折角の高萩市のご厚意が台無しです。

トイレは現在新築中ですが、仮設はあります。
テントの張れそうな場所には石のテーブルがあって結構便利。
川のそばに降りてすぐの所は多分特等席です。

9.9(土)に利用させていただきました。川がとても綺麗で癒されます。岩魚が泳いでるのには驚きました(^^)休日でしたが、人が少なく静かに過ごせました。
しかし、ゴミがそのままだったり、炭やペグが普通に落ちていたりと・・少し残念

乗り入れ不可(場内から見えない10㍍離れた駐車場)
簡易トイレあり、水場あり、自販機あり(今だけ??)

auLTE電波maxです。
サイト（設営可能面積）が小さいので家族連れなど全くおらず静かでソロ向けキャンプ場だと思います。
小川の流れる音も正にせせらぎ程度なのでのんびりできます。
ただ、ゴミの置き去りが目に余ります。当たり前の事ですが、他所の様に閉鎖される前に、きちんと持ち帰る事をおすすめします。

name: New Kirifu campsite
location: Japan, 〒321-1421 Tochigi-ken, Nikkō-shi, Tokorono, 所野霧降高原1545-6
comments: Camped here for G.W. 2017.  There are several cabins just big enough to sleep in.  We pitched a tent (a few spots with electrical service [additional cost]).  Stayed in the upper field, with only one porta-potty.  Fairly nice place with a lot of free wood for campfires, just walk into the woods.  Most other campers were courteous of others (one group of 20STH males, not).  Most sites are not shaded (helps dry out tent and tarp).  Watch out for deer droppings!
I used this caravan site early on Nov. Instead of freezing temperature we monopolied a sky full of stars , night view of Nikko, and silence of a forest. Warmth of fire was special.
looks nice.

7月３連休の日、月で利用。
利用客は家族連れが多いがオートキャンプエリアが上と下と２箇所あり、子供連れの方々はほとんど下のサイトを利用されていて上のサイトはさほど混雑もしておらず、夜も静かで過ごし易かった。
標高９００Mということもあり夏は涼しくてかなり快適な夜を過ごせました。
ただ朝の散歩に横の隠れ三滝に続く遊歩道（といっても舗装などあまりされていません）を歩いていたらいつの間にかヒルに血を吸われていました。
ご利用の方はご注意を！
キャンプ場自体は気に入ったが、早朝(4時過ぎ〜6時頃まで)キャンプ場近くの道をバイクか車が爆音でローリングしていて、とてもうるさかった。

name: Nasunogahara Park Auto Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒329-2807 Tochigi-ken, Nasushiobara-shi, Niwatoko, 栃木県那須塩原市接骨木字川西４５２－９
comments: １月後半に年明け初キャンプをキャビンで過ごしました。冬季料金のためほぼ半額、４人で約１００００円でした。　室内の天井が高くエアコンだけでは暖房がプアです。それを見越して灯油ストーブを持ち込んで正解でした。ちっちゃなコタツで和気藹々♪。お風呂もゆっくり入れてここを選んでくれた友人に感謝です。

オートキャンプサイト
電源があります。敷地内に小さいですが温泉施設とシャワールームがあり汗を流せます。風呂は綺麗でした。入湯税大人１人100円。
ゴミは透明もしくは半透明な袋なら置いて帰れます。
売店は夜１０時まで開いてます。
直火禁止。
花火エリアあり。消火用バケツもある。
友人を呼んで一緒にBBQしました。サイト内ならかまわないと了解得ました。

正月 2日から一泊で利用しました。初の冬キャンプでしたが 自由度の高い温泉♨️がキャンプ場内にある為、快適に過ごせました。
お湯は少し熱めですが冷えた体には最高です。
因みに源泉はピラミッド温泉みたいです。

コスパかなり高いです！

隣接の公園も充実してます。
近くには千本松牧場と野が原公園があり、夏場はプールに入れます。お風呂は小さく、時々マナーの悪い客がお風呂の鍵をかけてしまい他の客に使わせ無い様にするなど、混雑時は不快です。
公園のキャンプ場ということで自然味はあまりないですが、設備やテントサイトは手入れが行き届いているように感じました。家族連れにはオススメの場所です。

name: Washinosu Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒321-3561 Tochigi-ken, Haga-gun, Motegi-machi, Uragō, 茂木町大字後郷1322
comments:
地図では川が近くにあるように見えましたが、キャンプ場自体が山を登ったところにあるので、川までサイトから歩いて行けないので、残念でした。
ちょっと高台にあるので晴れると眺めはいいかもしれませんが、特になにもない感じです。
2泊の連泊でしたが、ツインリンクモテギに行く目的でもなければもう行かないと思います。
キャンプ場までの坂道はきついですが、コンクリで整備されているので荷物を沢山乗せた軽でも登れます。
なかなか良い。
1区画 4500円 安い

二度目の キャンプ、テントサイトで予約していたのですが、突然の雷雨で コテージに変更 
バス トイレ キッチン TV エアコン 電子レンジまで付いていて 最高でした ウッドデッキも屋根付き ガス付き なので そこで BBQやって来ました

name: Tochigiken Kenminnomori Camping Ground
comments: 子供と訪れました。森林が深く標高もそこそこあるため、寒いくらいに過ごしやすかったです。6月中旬で暑さをしのげればと、キャンプ場を探してみて、ここに決めて良かったです。管理人さんは親切で、管理棟では、ジュース、コーヒー、お茶が飲み放題でした。100円シャワーに入る前にみんなでテレビを観ながら、2～3杯飲んでしまいました。あえて言うなら、キャンプの1サイトが540円と安いのですが、もう少し広いとテントをはるスペース以外も余裕かなと、思いまいた。ただ、それも広場や、ベンチの上に屋根があるスペースがあるためOKかなと思いました。
管理人さん常駐。応対は丁寧。テントサイトは500円ほど。100円で充分使えるコインシャワー。川の流れる音がちょっと大きい以外文句なしです。
山奥にあるキャンプ場でクワガタやカブトムシにも触れる事ができます。コインシャワーはありますが、温泉は少し離れたところまで行かないとありません。また、サイト内は車の乗り入れが出来ないので駐車場から荷物を運ぶ事になります。
子供向けのイベントで何度か訪れました。バンガローを利用したことはありませんのでわかりませんが、キャンプ場としては、よい雰囲気です。

name: Forest of sunlight throughout camp and Spa Resort
comments: 5000¥ for sleeping in a car for one night.

料金形態が不誠実。サイトが激狭。露天風呂も洗い場が２個のみ、馬鹿みたいに列びます。
それからゴミは1袋500円で引き取りとか…分別して出したら2個で1000円て？目が点になりました。遠くからここのオーナーが、｢ゴミは1袋500円だからな！必ず取れよ！｣と従業員を怒鳴ってました😡
★ひとつは1人だけ男性従業員の対応が良かったので。
2度来ないキャンプ場ランキング1位です。
電気が使えるしトイレも洋式で結構キレイなので、お手軽キャンプにもってこい。露天風呂は掛け流しは20時までですが、24時間使えるので便利です。洗い場は2つしかないし、湯舟は5人くらいでいっぱいです。大人数グループはバラバラに行くか、19～21時を避けた方がいいと思います。
ロケーション、温泉など魅力あるキャンプ場。しかし、値段設定が高すぎるように思う。（テント一張りいくら、タープ張ると追加料金＋利用料金一人いくらとか）

お猿さんの名前のついたログハウスを利用させてもらいました。源泉かけ流しの温泉は最高、釣り堀でニジマスだけでなくイワナやヤマメを釣れる楽しみもあり、料金も比較的良心的だと思います。HPに表記はありませんが、部屋の中に冷蔵庫・石油ファンヒーター、おふとん、テーブル、ソファーがあり外にはテーブルと椅子がありました。
あとなんといってもオーナーはじめ従業員の方々が暖かいそんな感じを受けました。
いつかテント泊と思いながらも、色々なキャンプ場の施設を利用している我が家ですが、間違いなく今までで最高のキャンプ場でした。

name: Oyazawa Park Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒311-3122 Ibaraki-ken, Higashiibaraki-gun, Ibaraki-machi, Kamiishizaki, 茨城県東茨城郡茨城町上石崎４１４４－４
comments: Helpful and very freindly, great little spot

まずロケーションが最高！
トイレも綺麗
ゆったりしている
釣りもしたけどハゼが15匹くらい釣れた！
マキを買い忘れたので近くを探して歩いたら近くの家の人がマキをタダでくれた琵琶もとっていいと言ってくれて沢山貰った。
人もいい！
コンビニまでは車で６分
シャワーは洗い場に一応ついてるけどお湯は出ないので汚れを落とすくらい！

それでもここのキャンプ場はいいと思いました(^^♪
予約なしで飛び込みで1700位に行きました。管理人さんに優しく怒られました。ちゃんと連絡しましょう。場自体は静かでとても良いところだと思います。
水戸光圀公が「子を思ふ涙ひぬまの一つ松　波にゆられて幾代へぬらむ」という歌を詠んだとされる古くからの景勝地の一つで、茨城県指定名勝になっています。天気が良ければ、筑波山も見えて、湖面に映る夕陽と組み合わせると当に絶景✨
デイキャンプやシーバス釣りによくきました。昔は夏場にシジミがとれましたが今は開放してないようです。

name: Torinome Kasen Koen Auto Camping Ground
comments: 入口を入って、川沿いに細長く延びるオートキャンプ場。程よい間隔の森の中にあり、木漏れ日が気持ち良い。オートサイトは広々で、整備された水平の各サイトには芝生が養生。場内を小川が流れてるけど、清流ではない。トイレ、コインシャワーは綺麗。タープでゴミを丸出しにしているサイトにはゴミを漁るカラスが集まり、散らかし放題。これはキャンプ場の責任というよりは、それぞれのモラルの問題。ゴミは分別すれば大抵捨てられる。

GWにフリーサイトで利用しましたが、整備されており、大変きれいな環境で気持ちよく過ごせました。管理事務所にレンタルサイクルがあり、川沿いをサイクリングして楽しみました。14インチ～大人の自転車(子ども後乗せ)もありました。少し走れば遊具の充実した河畔公園で遊べます！
この季節要注意なのは、フリーサイト側の小川橋を渡り、植栽付近に、ブヨが大発生しておりました。数ヵ所に固まりブンブンしており、ハエによく似ております。子どももよく遊ぶエリアのため、必ず事前によく大人が下調べをして、探検などさせたほう良いです。虫除けをし、レギンスを履いていたにもかかわらず、気づいたら咬まれておりビックリしました。フリーサイトの川沿いを利用する際は、ブヨにも強い虫除けスプレー、服装や時間帯等も含め、しっかりとしたブヨ対策と、リンデロン軟膏や、ムヒのブヨにも効く虫刺され薬を持参されますことを強くおすすめします。
屋根ありバーベキューは人気なので予約は早目に！屋根なしでも木陰なので雨さえ降らなければ大丈夫です。
12人用のコテージを借りましたが、設備もかなり新しく清潔でした。しかも広い。安くてお得なコテージでした。

キャンプ場としては 広くてとても雰囲気のいいところです。
よく整備されていると思います。

name: Utsunomiyashi Shinrin Koen Camping Ground
comments:
森林の中のBBQコンロがあります。陽射しの強い夏には木陰になるので過ごしやすいいと思います。目の前には荷物を積み下ろせる停車場が2～3台ぶんありますが、車を長時間止める場合は徒歩5分ほどの距離の無料駐車場におくことになります。
コンロは大型の常設アミがあり、個人で持ってきた鉄板をアミの上に載せて使いました。常設のアミで直接肉を焼くのは衛生的にな観点で個人的にはやりたくないので、鉄板とかアミを持参するのがよいと思います。
ＢＢＱ場には水道があります。トイレはすぐ近くにあります。
アスレチックが目の前にあるので子供はもっぱらそっちで遊んでいて楽しめていました。
バーベキューもできます。ちょっと笑ってしまう看板ですが(^^)
こがしやまに登る方向に進むと、一人静やコシアブラ等あり、自然豊です。
森林公園のキャンプ場です。
静かな湖と森、散歩のいいところ。八重桜満開の時、凄く綺麗！

name: Takahagishi Keyakidaira Camping Ground
comments:
静かでシンプルなキャンプ場です。
手入れの行き届いたトイレ・水場・フィールド
管理人の方も親切です。
キャンプ場までのアプローチは狭い林道ですので車の脱輪やバイク初心者は注意が必要です。

広くてのんびり出来て、綺麗なトイレ、ピカピカの炊事棟、海まで見える景色、屋根のあるもの総てに避雷針。
１区画に１個ついてるカマドがあり、焚き火が出来ます。風の強い時は出来ませんけど、カマドを使う時は管理の方に網を貸して貰えます。１区画には2～3人用のテントなら4張り出来る広さなのでグループで利用したり、勿論ソロキャンプでも利用出来る。4/12に利用しましたが、強風で焚き火は断念。夜空を見上げると星が綺麗に見えたので良かった。また利用します。
トイレや炊事棟や非難棟は、凄くきれいでした。トイレは、１日３回も掃除をしてるみたいです。サイトに横付けは、出来ないので、荷物をサイトまで運びます。水道は、煮沸のみの飲料が可能です。水は、持って行った方がいいです。ドコモのスマホは、ネット・電話はつながりませんでした。管理人さんのおじさんは、気さくな人でした。

炊事場とトイレがあるシンプルなキャンプ場
一区画にかまどが一つあります。
きれいに手入れされていて良いところですよ！
